thread.title: Dallas-based Monuments Men Foundation closing over fund
thread.title_full: Dallas-based Monuments Men Foundation closing over fund

author: wtopstaff
title: Dallas-based Monuments Men Foundation closing over fund
text:
Home » News » Entertainment » Movies » Dallas-based Monuments Men Foundation… Dallas-based Monuments Men Foundation closing over fund By The Associated Press October 21, 2015 7:44 am 
DALLAS (AP) — The Monuments Men Foundation honoring efforts to save 5 million pieces of art during World War II will close due to lack of money. 
Robert Edsel, the Dallas-based author who wrote the book the led to the 2014 movie “The Monuments Men,” on Tuesday cited funding issues. 
The group will be honored Thursday in Washington, D.C., with a Congressional Gold Medal. Edsel told The Dallas Morning News (http://bit.ly/1RnyDJ5 ) that the Monuments Men Foundation will stop operating at the end of October. 
Edsel, who made his money in oil and gas, helped establish the art preservation foundation that drew attention following his 2009 book and the movie starring George Clooney. 
Edsel says documenting and sharing the group’s stories cost more than $7 million. The foundation raised half. Edsel paid the rest. 
___
